title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: members, contributors, leaders pledge make participation community harassment-free experience everyone, regardless age, body size, visible invisible disability, ethnicity, sex characteristics, gender identity expression, level experience, education, socio-economic status, nationality, personal appearance, race, caste, color, religion, sexual identity orientation. pledge act interact ways contribute open, welcoming, diverse, inclusive, healthy community.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Examples behavior contributes positive environment community include: Demonstrating empathy kindness toward people respectful differing opinions, viewpoints, experiences Giving gracefully accepting constructive feedback Accepting responsibility apologizing affected mistakes, learning experience Focusing best just us individuals, overall community Examples unacceptable behavior include: use sexualized language imagery, sexual attention advances kind Trolling, insulting derogatory comments, personal political attacks Public private harassment Publishing others’ private information, physical email address, without explicit permission conduct reasonably considered inappropriate professional setting

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community leaders responsible clarifying enforcing standards acceptable behavior take appropriate fair corrective action response behavior deem inappropriate, threatening, offensive, harmful. Community leaders right responsibility remove, edit, reject comments, commits, code, wiki edits, issues, contributions aligned Code Conduct, communicate reasons moderation decisions appropriate.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Code Conduct applies within community spaces, also applies individual officially representing community public spaces. Examples representing community include using official e-mail address, posting via official social media account, acting appointed representative online offline event.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Instances abusive, harassing, otherwise unacceptable behavior may reported community leaders responsible enforcement rmagno@pattern.institute. complaints reviewed investigated promptly fairly. community leaders obligated respect privacy security reporter incident.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community leaders follow Community Impact Guidelines determining consequences action deem violation Code Conduct:

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: Use inappropriate language behavior deemed unprofessional unwelcome community. Consequence: private, written warning community leaders, providing clarity around nature violation explanation behavior inappropriate. public apology may requested.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: violation single incident series actions. Consequence: warning consequences continued behavior. interaction people involved, including unsolicited interaction enforcing Code Conduct, specified period time. includes avoiding interactions community spaces well external channels like social media. Violating terms may lead temporary permanent ban.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: serious violation community standards, including sustained inappropriate behavior. Consequence: temporary ban sort interaction public communication community specified period time. public private interaction people involved, including unsolicited interaction enforcing Code Conduct, allowed period. Violating terms may lead permanent ban.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: Demonstrating pattern violation community standards, including sustained inappropriate behavior, harassment individual, aggression toward disparagement classes individuals. Consequence: permanent ban sort public interaction within community.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Code Conduct adapted Contributor Covenant, version 2.1, available https://www.contributor-covenant.org/version/2/1/code_of_conduct.html. Community Impact Guidelines inspired [Mozilla’s code conduct enforcement ladder][https://github.com/mozilla/inclusion]. answers common questions code conduct, see FAQ https://www.contributor-covenant.org/faq. Translations available https://www.contributor-covenant.org/translations.

title: Contributing to mgi.report.reader
text: want make bigger change, ’s good idea first file issue make sure someone team agrees ’s needed. ’ve found bug, please file issue illustrates bug minimal reprex (also help write unit test, needed).

title: Contributing to mgi.report.reader
text: Fork package clone onto computer. haven’t done , recommend using usethis::create_from_github("patterninstitute/mgi.report.reader", fork = TRUE). Install development dependencies devtools::install_dev_deps(), make sure package passes R CMD check running devtools::check(). R CMD check doesn’t pass cleanly, ’s good idea ask help continuing. Create Git branch pull request (PR). recommend using usethis::pr_init("brief-description--change"). Make changes, commit git, create PR running usethis::pr_push(), following prompts browser. title PR briefly describe change. body PR contain Fixes #issue-number. user-facing changes, add bullet top NEWS.md (.e. just first header). Follow style described https://style.tidyverse.org/news.html.

title: Ensembl IDs
text: marker_status: genetic marker status factor two levels: 'O' official, 'W' withdrawn. Official indicates currently -use genetic marker, whereas withdrawn means symbol name approved since replaced.

title: Ensembl IDs
text: marker_type: genetic marker type factor 10 levels: "Gene": locus cytoplasmic nuclear genome necessary sufficient express complete complement functional products derived unit transcription. "GeneModel": representation mRNA transcript gene contains information features transcript exon-intron boundaries, splice sites, UTRs, etc.. Due alternative splicing mRNA transcripts, may one gene model given gene. "Pseudogene": non-functional locus derived functional locus either : replicative transfer, transposition, retrotransposition duplication, mutation, non-functional locus considered allele existing functional locus mouse. "DNA Segment": genomic feature recognized anonymous DNA probes: segment DNA known correspond named gene can used marker construction genetic maps. "Transgene": DNA sequence combination sequences introduced via construct germ line animal random integration. "QTL": Quantitative Trait Locus (QTL): type marker described statistical association quantitative variation particular phenotypic trait thought controlled cumulative action alleles multiple loci. "Cytogenetic Marker": structure within chromosome visible microscopic examination, possibly special staining methods used. "BAC/YAC end": BAC/YAC end refers sequences end foreign DNA inserts BAC YAC. sequences source Sequence Tagged Sites (STSs) determine extent overlap Bacterial Artificial Chromosomes (BACs) Yeast Artificial Chromosome (YACs) aid alignment sequence contigs. "Complex/Cluster/Region": Refers following: Gene complex; group genes closely linked together related evolutionarily functionally. Interspersed unrelated genes located within group included. segment mouse genome defined comparison orthologous segment genome another species, specific characteristic, loss heterozygosity. marker repository information pertaining specific gene family, information lacks precise family member resolution. "Genome Feature": Refers feature genome considered biological significance classified defined marker types. Major classes genome features include Endogenous Viruses Retrotransposons, Integration Sites, Repetitive Elements. additional class features includes genomic segments function biologically significant DNA elements.

title: Genetic Marker
text: context Mouse Gene Informatics (MGI), genetic marker defined biological feature can used identify specific position chromosome various mapping methods genetic, physical, forms mapping. features include genes, anonymous DNA segments, mutations, phenotypes.

title: Genetic Marker
text: Positional reference: serve points reference locating genetic features chromosomes. Assay dependence: identification markers depends specific assays detect genetic variation. Biological significance: Markers can distinguish particular biological states, gene expression profiles characteristic morphologies.

title: Genetic Marker
text: Gene: functional unit inheritance, usually encoding protein RNA. DNA Segment: Mapped anonymous DNA segments used generating genetic maps. Cytogenetic Marker: Identified cytogenetic techniques, visible microscope. Quantitative Trait Locus (QTL): Polymorphic loci associated variation phenotypic traits. Transgene: Genes transferred naturally number genetic engineering techniques. Pseudogene: Non-functional sequences resemble functional genes. BAC/YAC Ends: Ends Bacterial Artificial Chromosomes (BACs) Yeast Artificial Chromosomes (YACs) used mapping. Genome Features: identified features within genome. Complex/Cluster/Region: Grouped genomic entities located closely chromosome. marker types retrievable marker_types().

title: Genetic Marker
text: Markers provide framework organizing communicating genetic information, facilitating mapping genetic features, helping identification genes responsible phenotypic traits. Mouse Genome Informatics (MGI), marker object unique official nomenclature assigned, .e. accession identifier: unique alphanumeric character string used unambiguously identify particular record MGI database. report data returned read_report() variable called marker_id. common accompanying variables include: marker_status: marker status, indicating whether currently -use genetic marker, withdrawn . marker_type: type genetic marker, discussed . marker_name: word phrase uniquely identifies genetic marker, e.g. gene allele name. marker_symbol: unique abbreviation marker name.

title: Genetic Marker
text: Guidelines Nomenclature Genes, Genetic Markers, Alleles, Mutations Mouse Rat. Eppig JT, Motenko H, Richardson JE, Richards-Smith B, Smith CL. 2015. International Mouse Strain Resource (IMSR): cataloging worldwide mouse ES cell line resources. Mamm Genome. 26(9–10):448–455. doi:10.1007/s00335-015-9600-0. MGI Glossary: MGI Accession ID.

title: MGI Marker Coordinates
text: marker_type: genetic marker type factor 10 levels: "Gene": locus cytoplasmic nuclear genome necessary sufficient express complete complement functional products derived unit transcription. "GeneModel": representation mRNA transcript gene contains information features transcript exon-intron boundaries, splice sites, UTRs, etc.. Due alternative splicing mRNA transcripts, may one gene model given gene. "Pseudogene": non-functional locus derived functional locus either : replicative transfer, transposition, retrotransposition duplication, mutation, non-functional locus considered allele existing functional locus mouse. "DNA Segment": genomic feature recognized anonymous DNA probes: segment DNA known correspond named gene can used marker construction genetic maps. "Transgene": DNA sequence combination sequences introduced via construct germ line animal random integration. "QTL": Quantitative Trait Locus (QTL): type marker described statistical association quantitative variation particular phenotypic trait thought controlled cumulative action alleles multiple loci. "Cytogenetic Marker": structure within chromosome visible microscopic examination, possibly special staining methods used. "BAC/YAC end": BAC/YAC end refers sequences end foreign DNA inserts BAC YAC. sequences source Sequence Tagged Sites (STSs) determine extent overlap Bacterial Artificial Chromosomes (BACs) Yeast Artificial Chromosome (YACs) aid alignment sequence contigs. "Complex/Cluster/Region": Refers following: Gene complex; group genes closely linked together related evolutionarily functionally. Interspersed unrelated genes located within group included. segment mouse genome defined comparison orthologous segment genome another species, specific characteristic, loss heterozygosity. marker repository information pertaining specific gene family, information lacks precise family member resolution. "Genome Feature": Refers feature genome considered biological significance classified defined marker types. Major classes genome features include Endogenous Viruses Retrotransposons, Integration Sites, Repetitive Elements. additional class features includes genomic segments function biologically significant DNA elements.

title: Read Mouse Genome Informatics Reports
text: Use read_report() read supported MGI report R, e.g. read MRK_List1.rpt:

title: Convert marker symbols to updated marker identifiers — convert_to_marker_id
code: convert_to_marker_id(x, rpt)

title: Convert marker symbols to updated marker identifiers — convert_to_marker_id
text: x character vector marker symbols remapped. rpt Report data tibble offering translation table old (marker_symbol) symbols new (marker_id_now) marker identifiers. Hence, least, following two columns required encode mapping: marker_symbol: symbols matched values x. marker_id_now: new marker identifiers returned case match. Almost always, rpt take result read_report("marker_list1").

title: Convert marker symbols to updated marker identifiers — convert_to_marker_id
text: character vector date marker identifiers.

title: Convert marker symbols to updated marker identifiers — convert_to_marker_id
code: # Reading only the first 100 markers (for efficiency) rpt <- read_report("marker_list1", n_max = 100) head(rpt) #> # A tibble: 6 × 15 #>   marker_status marker_type marker_id   marker_symbol   marker_name feature_type #>   <fct>         <fct>       <chr>       <chr>           <chr>       <fct>        #> 1 O             BAC/YAC end MGI:1341858 03B03F          DNA segmen… BAC/YAC end  #> 2 O             BAC/YAC end MGI:1341869 03B03R          DNA segmen… BAC/YAC end  #> 3 O             DNA Segment MGI:1337005 03.MMHAP34FRA.… DNA segmen… DNA segment  #> 4 W             Gene        NA          0610005A07Rik   NA          NA           #> 5 O             Gene        MGI:1918911 0610005C13Rik   RIKEN cDNA… lncRNA gene  #> 6 W             Gene        NA          0610005K03Rik   NA          NA           #> # ℹ 9 more variables: chromosome <fct>, start <int>, end <int>, strand <fct>, #> #   genetic_map_pos <dbl>, synonyms <list>, marker_id_now <chr>, #> #   marker_symbol_now <chr>, note <chr>  # Note that: #   - "0610005A07Rik" is a withdrawn symbol, so gets remapped to Gstm7. #   - "0610005C13Rik" is an official symbol, so stays the same. #   - "not a symbol" is not an existing symbol in `rpt`, so gets mapped to `NA`. symbols <- c("0610005A07Rik", "0610005C13Rik", "not a symbol") convert_to_marker_id(x = symbols, rpt = rpt) #> [1] "MGI:1915562" "MGI:1918911" NA

title: Read an MGI report — read_report
text: read_report() imports data MGI report R tidy data set. may call function two alternative ways: Using report_key: easiest approach. report key maps report currently hosted MGI, e.g. read_report("marker_list2") reads MRK_List2.rpt directly MGI server R. See Supported Reports options. Using report_file report_type: approach flexible can read directly file URL.

text: x character vector marker symbols remapped. rpt Report data tibble offering translation table old (marker_symbol) new (marker_symbol_now) symbols. Hence, least, following two columns required encode mapping: marker_symbol: symbols matched values x. marker_symbol_now: new symbols returned case match. Almost always, rpt take result read_report("marker_list1").

title: Update marker symbols — update_marker_symbol
text: character vector date symbols.

title: Update marker symbols — update_marker_symbol
code: # Reading only the first 100 markers (for efficiency) rpt <- read_report("marker_list1", n_max = 100) head(rpt) #> # A tibble: 6 × 15 #>   marker_status marker_type marker_id   marker_symbol   marker_name feature_type #>   <fct>         <fct>       <chr>       <chr>           <chr>       <fct>        #> 1 O             BAC/YAC end MGI:1341858 03B03F          DNA segmen… BAC/YAC end  #> 2 O             BAC/YAC end MGI:1341869 03B03R          DNA segmen… BAC/YAC end  #> 3 O             DNA Segment MGI:1337005 03.MMHAP34FRA.… DNA segmen… DNA segment  #> 4 W             Gene        NA          0610005A07Rik   NA          NA           #> 5 O             Gene        MGI:1918911 0610005C13Rik   RIKEN cDNA… lncRNA gene  #> 6 W             Gene        NA          0610005K03Rik   NA          NA           #> # ℹ 9 more variables: chromosome <fct>, start <int>, end <int>, strand <fct>, #> #   genetic_map_pos <dbl>, synonyms <list>, marker_id_now <chr>, #> #   marker_symbol_now <chr>, note <chr>  # Note that: #   - "0610005A07Rik" is a withdrawn symbol, so gets remapped to Gstm7. #   - "0610005C13Rik" is an official symbol, so stays the same. #   - "not a symbol" is not an existing symbol in `rpt`, so gets mapped to `NA`. symbols <- c("0610005A07Rik", "0610005C13Rik", "not a symbol") update_marker_symbol(x = symbols, rpt = rpt) #> [1] "Gstm7"         "0610005C13Rik" NA

title: mgi.report.reader 0.1.0
text: Extensive documentation supported MGI reports. flexible interface read_report(). Report data now accompanied attributes providing report last modification date source: report_last_modified() report_source(). Marker crosswalks old symbols: update_marker_symbol() convert_to_marker_id(). New helper quickly browse information MGI marker: open_marker_in_mgi().
